text:
Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that has a different stress pattern from the other four.

    A. Ahead
    B. aloud
    C. behold
    D. decode
    E. goalpost

From the options lettered A - E, choose the one that is the most appropriate interpretation of the expression in italics

After Uduak had killed his wife, he attempted to cover his tracks by making her death appear like suicide. This means that Uduak

options.A: covered the face of his dead wife with a track-suit
options.D: tried to hide what he had done

From the options lettered A - E, choose the one that is the most appropriate interpretation of the expression in italics

The coach said that he would infuse new blood into the team in preparation for the next competition. This means that

options.A: members of the team would undergo blood transfusion
options.B: members of the team will be tested to determine their fitness
options.C: new players would be recruited to strengthen the team
options.D: old members of the team" would be served blood tonic to make them perform better
options.E: the coach was not satisfied with the performance of the team

The activities marking the golden jubilee celebration of the club were rounded ........ with a party fit.

Choose from the options lettered A - E the question that is best answered by the statement containing the street word which is written in capital letters.

ALL the final year students passed the test.

options.A: Did all the final year students fall the test?
options.B: Did some final year students pass the test?
options.C: Did all the first year students pass the test?
options.D: Did all the final year students pass the exam?
options.E: Do all the final year students pass the test

text:
Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that is nearest in meaning to the words in italics in the following questions

Africans treasure hospitality as a way of life

Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that most appropriately completes the sentence

“Don’t wear_________ yourself by trying to do too much too soon” the instructor warned,

Complete this statement with the most appropriate of the options lettered A- E

Though Chike has been ........ his colleagues believe that he committed the crime.
explanation: The word"Though"indicates acontrast, so we are looking for a word that shows Chike was officiallycleared of guilt, butothers still suspect him. To be exonerated means to show that someone or something is not guilty of something.

Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that rhymes with the word given

Choose from the options lettered A- E the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the word or expression in italics

Your action is in negation of our earlier decision.
explanation: The word"negation"means denial, contradiction, or refusal. The opposite of this would beagreementorharmonywith something. To be inconsonance withmeans to agree with or be in harmony with, which is the direct opposite of negation.To be inconnection withdoes not directly oppose "negation" as one can be connected to something without agreeing with it.

text:
Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that contains the sound segment represented by the given phonetic symbol

/j /

Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that most appropriately completes the sentence

The doctor said to the nurse, “Get something to bring her_________ she’s fainted.”
explanation: Bring round is a phrasal verb that means to restore someone to consciousness.

text:
Complete this statement with the most appropriate of the options lettered A- E

After three consecutive months without pay at work, we are beginning to feel the____________
explanation: The phrase "feel the crunch" is an idiomatic expression that means experiencing pressure, difficulty or hardship, especially in financial or resource-related situations. In this sentence, "crunch" means the growing difficulty or hardship caused by the lack of income.

Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that most appropriately completes the sentence

I had __________ little time that I couldn’t the work.
explanation: "so" emphasises the extent or degree of the limited time. It indicates that the amount of time available was to such an extent that it was insufficient to complete the work.  So, the completed sentence reads: "I had so little time that I couldn't do the work."
